title: Good company to work for
pros: Great company to work for.
cons: No negative or cons to share.

title: AHCC
pros: Great people, great core values and great experience
cons: A common theme in construction and not just AHCC is the long hours and stressful work.

title: Good Company
pros: Great co-workers, interesting projects, high level of professionalism and a company you can be proud to work for.
cons: Sometimes too corporate and raises/promotions are few and far between.

title: Work, Work balance
pros: You will learn volumes and the pay is pretty good*
cons: *The pay is pretty good if you were to only work 40-50 hours a week*The teams are not put together well and they are severely understaffed. Some individuals doing the bare minimum, with no consequences. At the same time, others are expected to review work at home and remain on site longer than they already are. While this is a typical story, it is extreme here. The teams should be staffed with twice the personnel, possibly more. If you plan on leaving, make sure to burn up your PTO because they will NOT pay more than 40 hours of accrued time. (It’s buried in the handbook and legal)

title: Good
pros: I am happy happy happy
cons: Can not think of any ro add

pros: Good PTO Flexibility even during busy season
cons: Underestimated, undervalued, overworked, and no growth.

title: Team
pros: The IT team is great and always eager to learn from each other.
cons: There is no unlimited PTO.

title: LOVE Armada Hoffler
pros: Amazing leadership and awesome benefits. It is a wonderful place to work!
cons: I don't have any cons or complaints.

title: Amazing company
pros: Great upper management, manageable workload, friendly fun environment
cons: Long hours during quarter end

title: No work-life balance
pros: Coworkers were wonderful Benefits were good
cons: Blatant favoritism Perpetually increasing workload with no increase in pay Expected to work minimum 50 hours a week

title: Ok place to be, great place to learn
pros: CEO is great, other execs are new and still developing
cons: will be over worked, wont be compensated

title: Potential is here
pros: Fun people, interesting projects, growth potential if you apply yourself. Fantastic HR department.
cons: Zero training, while there is potential for growth - everyone higher up is pretty miserable. No flexibility in my position. You must be self driven or you won’t make it.

title: Highly Recommend
pros: Amazing place to work-people are so friendly and fun to work with.
cons: I don’t have any cons

title: Awesome People
pros: The work environment is great! Lots of company-wide events and employee appreciation.
cons: As a graphic designer, I felt that I wasn't pushed creatively, but I learned a lot about project management and workflow in programs I wouldn't normally use. Not a serious con.

title: Depends on what you need
pros: They give you all the tools for success initially
cons: Everyone is fair game no matter how long you’ve been there

title: Horrible job
pros: Good benefits and good pay
cons: This is a fine place to work if you only care about your job and do not want to have a life outside of work. The management could not care less about what you have going on in your personal life; to them, work should be the #1 priority in your life. You will stay late more times than you will get to leave on time (by far). You can try to leave on time, but you will likely get told that you actually need to stay until 9:00pm anyway. Working here was the worst experience of my life and driving out of the garage on my last day was one of the happiest moments of my life. I felt like a huge weight was lifted the day I left that place.

title: Avoid if you can, unless you like overwork
pros: Individual people were very nice, as long as you don't want to work as a team. Location is great - right in Town Center, close to restaurants and shopping.
cons: Silo mentality- there is no teamwork. Upper management has no idea what the lower level jobs entail, and thus assume that people have capacity to take on more tasks. They're always understaffed, and when they give you the workload of two people, there's no additional compensation.

title: Great place to work
pros: Armada Hoffler is a great company to work for. A very strong focus on safety, with additional safety training throughout the year. They only hire qualified subcontractors that have gone through a pretty rigorous qualification process. This leads to their projects running smoother than most and a professional work environment in the field. They are a mid to large company but they absolutely make you feel like family. They truly care about their employees. Wages are on par or a little above industry standards and their benefits package is excellent.
cons: I have no complaints about working for Armada Hoffler.

title: Great opportunities
pros: I've worked for the company for over 3 years now and I've had the opportunity to wear several hats and really like that they are open to employees growing with the company and have opportunities to change positions and move up the ladder.
cons: Having some "growing pains" because of the rapid growth but they are diligently working to improve.

title: Such a great place to work!
pros: The people are great, you are able to learn so much and it’s such a tight community. I love how structured it is and how if there is an issue you they listen to you. They do their best to take you to where you want to be. Everyone is a really hard worker.
cons: No cons other than could have higher pay.

title: Management
pros: Great place to work. Positive attitude by company and its employees. Strives to produce excellence in building for their clients and self
cons: There are really no cons to submit. AHP looks to improve in all areas that suggest or have a discussion concerning.

pros: Had great lower level management and employees.
cons: AH seems more concerned with how the employees look then their actual skill set.. HR actually spoke openly about not hiring a temp due to her obesity..they would prefer everyone in suits daily but do not pay salaries that support that. I found HR to be one of the most unprofessional that I had ever worked with and higher levels of management to be very disconnected.

title: Overwork and Underpay
pros: -Hardly any pros to add
cons: -Long hours with nonequivalent compensation -Expectation to take on additional tasks without being told to do so -Expect perfection without adequate training times -Benefits are ok at best -Performance issues not addressed until too late to change actions regarding them

title: Great People
pros: It’s a fast paced environment which keeps things exciting. They care about their employees with great benefits and employee appreciation events.
cons: The work I did was redundant.

title: MARKETING
pros: Great company, great environment. I would recommend this company to anyone.
cons: This position was temporary and only lasted a few months

title: Great Place to Work
pros: Great leadership, consistently wins employment awards
cons: Job descriptions are fluid, but you get to work on a broad spectrum because of that

title: Great Place to work
pros: Fosters opportunities to learn and grow within the company
cons: Part of any construction job is having to travel

title: Beware
pros: Nothing truly stands out. If you are deemed important enough you get a nice office. There is always parking available.
cons: Office politics including RAMPANT nepotism. Incredibly high churn rate. People are constantly gossiping. Benefits will only pay off if you stay there forever.

title: Great place to work
pros: Great people and a fun environment.
cons: I didn't experience any cons.

title: Smart people
pros: Intelligent leadership; fair; respectful atmosphere
cons: I have no cons to share.

title: Normal company
pros: Normal company normal team normal boss
cons: Basically nothing special all normal
